column4: what could be the reason for a service not to start at boot time, when it starts just fine manually with 'service name start' and has all appropriate symlinks in rcN.d dirs?
could be something in /etc/default/ telling it not to
what could it be in /etc/default, I'm just not sure. I've just added it, it's 'mongrel_cluster' service.
usually there's a name there that directly relates to the name of the application in question.
and if there's no such file, the service doesn't start? I'm just not familiar with /etc/default and it's purposes
some programs have them there, some don't. try looking at some of the files there to get a better idea.
